metadata.title: CVE-2023-23946 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: Git, a revision control system, is vulnerable to path traversal prior toversions 2.39.2, 2.38.4, 2.37.6, 2.36.5, 2.35.7, 2.34.7, 2.33.7, 2.32.6,2.31.7, and 2.30.8. By feeding a crafted input to `git apply`, a pathoutside the working tree can be overwritten as the user who is running `gitapply`. A fix has been prepared and will appear in v2.39.2, v2.38.4,v2.37.6, v2.36.5, v2.35.7, v2.34.7, v2.33.7, v2.32.6, v2.31.7, and v2.30.8.As a workaround, use `git apply --stat` to inspect a patch before applying;avoid applying one that creates a symbolic link and then creates a filebeyond the symbolic link.

criterions.comment: git: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
